question: If water contracts on freezing, which of the following would happen?
option1: Icebergs will completely float on the surface of water
option3: Lakes would freeze from top to bottom
option4: Rocks will crack due to freezing or internal water
explanation: When liquid water is cooled, it contracts like one would expect until a temperature of approximately 4 degrees Celsius is reached. After that, it expands slightly until it reaches the freezing point, and then when it freezes it expands by approximately 9%.Ice becomes more dense when water contracts.
